intro: Eschweilera rotundicarpa, commonly known as the red-berried evergreen, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a member of the Lauraceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and striking red fruits. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, leathery, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. The fruit, which is round and fleshy, contains a single seed and is an important food source for various wildlife species.
